bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Baron Hugh Charles Clifford of Chudleigh (1790-1858) was a Catholic member of Parliament and author, who lived in self-imposed exile in Italy for religious reasons.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Chiefly letters from Clifford in Albano, Italy, to his son Charles. Topics include family matters, the Catholic Church in England, English politics, and commentary on the Crimean War, in which his third son, Henry Hugh Clifford, was an officer. Also includes a few letters to Clifford, and several between other family members.
